A piece of advice: we have parser.jar in our $ANT_HOME/lib directory, for
the sake of other components. This jar file may jam your <junitreport> if
appears before xalan.jar in the classpath.
Oren

____________________________________
Oren Gross Java(TM) Developer
Mercury Interactive APM TAC R&D 
+972-3-5399407 ogross@...


-----Original Message-----
From: Oren Gross [mailto:ogross@...]
Sent: Sunday, July 21, 2002 6:25 PM
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [junit] junitreport at junit3.5


Thanks for the reply, I thought we are the only nation to work on Sunday
;o) 
Since I found the exact same question unanswered in the archive from six
months ago, I hope this will satisfy some others as well. I did some
research, since it is Sunday, and not to many answers are published, is that
junitreport needs 
$ANT_HOME/lib/xerces.jar $ANT_HOME/lib/xalan.jar and
$ANT_HOME/lib/jasper.jar or $ANT_HOME/lib/xml=apis.jar
(http://xml.apache.org/xalan-j/index.html)

Thanks again
____________________________________
Oren Gross Java(TM) Developer
Mercury Interactive APM TAC R&D 
+972-3-5399407 ogross@...


-----Original Message-----
From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbr@...]
Sent: Sunday, July 21, 2002 5:22 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] junitreport at junit3.5


My guess is that the XSLT transformation is failing and the error
message is being hidden by a layer of exception reporting. You may want
to take this question to the Ant user mailing list in order to get Ant
experts on the case. A common problem is that JUnitReport cannot find
the .xsl stylesheet; another is that the XML it is trying to transform
is not well-formed. You can try looking at the XML files and see
whether any of them are not well-formed. I had a similar problem with
CruiseControl where the ends of XML logs were being written twice.

Good luck.

*********** REPLY SEPARATOR  ***********

On 2002-07-21 at 11:45 Oren Gross wrote:

>Hi all
>We are using Junit3.5 and Ant 1.4.1. In my build.xml file I have my
junit
>task, and afterwards I want to add the junitreport task. I am getting
>\home\<my_dir>\projects\<my_prj>\build.xml:288: Errors while applying
>transformations on the following section:
>	  <junitreport todir="${results.tests}">  <!-- this is line number
>288  -->
>          <fileset dir="${results.tests}">
>            <include name="TEST-*.xml" />
>          </fileset>
>          <report format="frames" todir="${results.tests}/html"/>
>        </junitreport>
>Any ideas?
>TIA Oren
